<h3 id="X37567">X(37567)&nbsp;=&nbsp; X(1)X(3)&cap;X(19)X(44)</h3>
Barycentrics &nbsp;&nbsp; a*(a^3 + 2*a^2*b - a*b^2 - 2*b^3 + 2*a^2*c - 2*a*b*c + 2*b^2*c - a*c^2 + 2*b*c^2 - 2*c^3) : :
<br>
Trilinears &nbsp;&nbsp; 2 cos B + 2 cos C - cos A - 1 : :
<p>
Let A'B'C' be the Hutson-extouch triangle.  Let Let L<sub>A</sub> be the tangent to the A-excircle at A', and define L<sub>B</sub> and L<sub>C</sub> cyclically.  Let A" = L<sub>B</sub>&cap;L<sub>C</sub>, and define B" and C" cyclically.  Triangle A"B"C" is homothetic to ABC at X(57), and X(37567) = X(56)-of-A"B"C".  (Randy Hutson, March 29, 2020)
</p>
<p>
Let A'B'C' be the extangents triangle.  Let A" be the trilinear pole, wrt A'B'C', of line BC, and define B" and C" cyclically.  The lines AA", BB", CC" concur in X(37567).  (Randy Hutson, March 29, 2020)
</p>
<p>
X(37567) lies on these lines: {1, 3}, {6, 4642}, {7, 15888}, {8, 529}, {9, 3698}, {10, 1836}, {11, 962}, {12, 4295}, {19, 44}, {20, 10950}, {30, 10573}, {45, 71}, {63, 5836}, {72, 3711}, {79, 9654}, 37001}, {33298, 33867}
</p>
<p>
X(37567) = trilinear pole, wrt extangents triangle, of antiorthic axis<br>
X(37567) = {X(1),X(40)}-harmonic conjugate of X(37568)<br>
</p>
